summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the preparation of a transition memo describing non-public investigations and matters. The sender, Counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney, attaches a draft response and notes one additional description from which they are recused.

persons.name: Counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is preparing a draft response regarding non-public investigations for a transition request.

events.title: Transition Request for Non-Public Investigations
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is preparing a response to a transition request for a description of non-public investigations and matters.
personsInvolved: Counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing a transition memo detailing non-public investigations and matters as of January 2021.
The email indicates the office had previously sent UMRs (Unknown Matter Reports) for some cases, but the sender included all cases in the draft regardless.
The sender notes being recused from one additional description, which they planned to send separately.
